de.iss.mv2.io

Class CommandLineInterpreter

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.iss.mv2.io.CommandLineInterpreter

  • public class CommandLineInterpreter
extends java.lang.Object
    An interpreter for command line arguments.
    Author:
    Marcel Singer

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommandLineInterpreter

        public CommandLineInterpreter(java.lang.String[] args,
                              boolean caseSensitiveOptions)
        Creates a new instance of CommandLineInterpreter.
        Parameters:
        args - The current arguments to interpret.
        caseSensitiveOptions - true if the options are case sensitive.

    • Method Detail

      • hasOption

        public boolean hasOption(java.lang.String option)
        Returns true if the arguments contain the given option.
        Parameters:
        option - The option to search.
        Returns:
        true if the arguments contain the given option.

      • isExclusive

        public boolean isExclusive(java.lang.String option,
                           java.lang.String... excludes)
        Returns true if the given option is specified and all excludes aren't. If the option is not specified, this method will also return true.
        Parameters:
        option - The allowed option.
        excludes - The options that aren't allowed if the option is present.
        Returns:
        true if the given option is specified and all excludes aren't. If the option is not specified, this method will also return true.

      • getExtras

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getExtras(java.lang.String option)
        Returns the extras specified for an option. For example: "-e extraE1 extraE2 -f extraF1 extraF3 extraF4".
        Parameters:
        option - The option thats extra values should be returned.
        Returns:
        The extras specified for an option.

      • stringEquals

        private boolean stringEquals(java.lang.String a,
                             java.lang.String b)
        Tests if both given strings are equal. Depending on the value of caseSensitiveOptions the case is ignored.
        Parameters:
        a - The first string.
        b - The second string.
        Returns:
        true if both strings are equal.
